titlestmt.titleproper: Commonwealth Fund records, Program Files, Accession 2013:074, SG 2
A Guide to the Commonwealth Fund records, Program Files, Accession 2013:074, SG 2 FA1332

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2019-11-01 00:59:42 -0400.

did.unittitle: Commonwealth Fund records, Program Files, Accession 2013:074, SG 2

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research with select materials restricted as noted. Brittle or damaged items are available at the discretion of RAC. Researchers interested in accessing digital media (floppy disks, CDs, DVDs, etc.) in this collection must use an access surrogate. The original items may not be accessed because of preservation concerns. To request an access surrogate be made, or if you are unsure if there is an access surrogate, please contact an archivist.

When requesting to view audiovisual material, please refer to the Title and the AV Number (example: AV 1916). Researchers are asked to check the "Restrictions" note for each Title. If a Title does not currently have an access copy, please contact a RAC archivist for further instruction.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This accession contains files from the following Commonwealth Fund programs: Task Force on Academic Health Centers, State Innovation Program (Health Reform), and Child Development and Preventive Care.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Records remain in original order as received.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Information regarding the Rockefeller Archive Center's preferred elements and forms of citation can be found at http://www.rockarch.org/research/citations.php

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: The Commonwealth Fund archives was donated to Rockefeller Archive Center in 1985. This material was transferred to RAC by the Commonwealth Fund in 2013, as Accession 2013:074.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Minimal processing, 2017. Some materials remain in original file folders.
